text:
He ran his fingers through his hair, elbows on the sticky table. 

“Might I engage you in conversation?” the clerk asked, looking resolute. 

Raskolnikov glanced up, surprised. 

“I respect education,” the clerk continued. “I’m Marmeladov, a titular counsellor. Have you served?”

“No, I am studying,” Raskolnikov replied, irritation rising. 

“A student! Just as I thought!” Marmeladov exclaimed, tapping his forehead. 

He staggered, then sat beside Raskolnikov, face slightly turned. 

“I have immense experience,” he said, slurring slightly. 

Raskolnikov felt the weight of the stranger’s gaze.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Marmeladov, a drunken clerk, engages Raskolnikov in conversation, expressing his respect for education despite his own disheveled state.
